00077 List::List(const string &n, BaseType *v) : Vector(n, v, dods_list_c)
00078 {
00079 }
00080 
00082 List::List(const List &rhs) : Vector(rhs)
00083 {
00084     //    _duplicate(rhs);
00085 }
00086 
00087 List::~List()
00088 {
00089 }
00090 
00091 BaseType *
00092 List::ptr_duplicate()
00093 {
00094     return new List(*this);
00095 }
00096 
00097 List &
00098 List::operator=(const List &rhs)
00099 {
00100     if (this == &rhs)
00101     return *this;
00102 
00103     dynamic_cast<Vector &>(*this) = rhs;
00104 
00105     _duplicate(rhs);
00106 
00107     return *this;
00108 }
00109 
00117 bool
00118 List::member(BaseType *btp, DDS &dds)
00119 {
00120     int len = length();
00121 
00122     for (int i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
00123     BaseType *a1 = var(i);  // get a pointer to the ith list element
00124     if (btp->ops(a1, SCAN_EQUAL, dds.filename()))
00125         return true;
00126     }
00127 
00128     return false;
00129 }
00130 
00132 bool
00133 List::null()
00134 {
00135     return (length() == 0);
00136 }

00178 // Revision 1.31.4.2  2001/07/28 01:10:42  jimg
00179 // Some of the numeric type classes did not have copy ctors or operator=.
00180 // I added those where they were needed.
00181 // In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00182 // just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00183 // before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00184 // just good form when using delete.
00185 // I added calls to www2id and id2www where appropriate. The DAP now handles
00186 // making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
00187 // set to handle CEs that contain names as they are in the dataset (see the
00188 // comments/Log there). Servers should not handle escaping or unescaping
00189 // characters on their own.

00195 // Added the Constructor class which is to Structures, Sequences and Grids
00196 // what Vector is to Arrays and Lists. This should be used in future
00197 // refactorings (I thought it was going to be used for the back pointers).
00198 // Introduced back pointers so children can refer to their parents in
00199 // hierarchies of variables.
00200 // Added to Sequence methods to tell if a child sequence is done

00203 // _duplicate().
00204 // Changed the way serialize and deserialize work for sequences. Now SOI and
00205 // EOS markers are written for every `level' of a nested Sequence. This
00206 // should fixed nested Sequences. There is still considerable work to do
00207 // for these to work in all cases.

00282 // Re-wrote List so that it uses the same basic algorithms as Array. The major
00283 // difference is that the length of the List must be set manually (since it
00284 // changes as the value of the list variable changes) whereas the length of an
00285 // array can be computed from its declaration.

00312 // Revision 1.10  1995/03/04  14:34:47  jimg
00313 // Major modifications to the transmission and representation of values:
00314 // Added card() virtual function which is true for classes that
00315 // contain cardinal types (byte, int float, string).
00316 // Changed the representation of Str from the C rep to a C++
00317 // class represenation.
00318 // Chnaged read_val and store_val so that they take and return
00319 // types that are stored by the object (e.g., inthe case of Str
00320 // an URL, read_val returns a C++ String object).
00321 // Modified Array representations so that arrays of card()
00322 // objects are just that - no more storing strings, ... as
00323 // C would store them.
00324 // Arrays of non cardinal types are arrays of the DODS objects (e.g.,
00325 // an array of a structure is represented as an array of Structure
00326 // objects).
00327 //

00330 // Private and protected symbols now start with `_'.
00331 // Added new accessors for name and type fields of BaseType; the old ones
00332 // will be removed in a future release.
00333 // Added the store_val() mfunc. It stores the given value in the object's
00334 // internal buffer.
00335 // Made both List and Str handle their values via pointers to memory.
00336 // Fixed read_val().
00337 // Made serialize/deserialize handle all malloc/free calls (even in those
00338 // cases where xdr initiates the allocation).
